reasoning: Shigella dysenteriae (Group A Shigella) causes bacillary dysentery with highest severity among shigellae species. Global incidence estimated at 2.5 per 100k person-years, primarily in developing countries with poor sanitation. Higher incidence in sub-Saharan Africa and South Asia (10-50 per 100k), lower in developed nations (<0.1 per 100k).
source: Kotloff KL et al. (2000). Global burden of Shigella infections. Lancet Infectious Diseases. 1(2):95-105
